title: FALSE: Gabby Lopez sold all his shares in ABS-CBN Corporation, Lopez Holdings
subtitle: Lopez still holds shares in both companies as of June 2020
author: rappler.com
vclaim:
As of writing, Sonza’s post had over 4,900 shares, 11,000 reactions, and 1,600 comments. It was flagged by Claim Check, Facebook’s monitoring tool. The tool showed it was reported at least 7 times for containing false information. Several readers also sent the post to Rappler for verification.

ABS-CBN Corporation’s quarterly report covering April to June 2020 showed that there were 769,960 direct shares in ABS-CBN Corporation under the chairman emeritus’ name – which remained consistent all throughout 2019. The company’s public ownership reports filed with the PSE can be found here. Lopez is also the 5th biggest stockholder of ABS-CBN Corporation as of June 2020.

Meanwhile, Lopez’s shares in ABS-CBN Holdings Corporation, another company owned by the Lopez family, turned to zero from the third quarter of 2019 to the first quarter of 2020. But ABS-CBN Holdings is a different company from ABS-CBN Corporation and Lopez Holdings Corp.

Lopez’s direct shares in ABS-CBN Holdings during the first half of 2019 stood at 1,344,725 and then turned to zero for the succeeding quarters until the first quarter of 2020. ABS-CBN Holdings initially reported zero shares under Lopez's name during the second quarter of 2020, but it filed another report to amend it on July 16, to show that he held 3,071,478 indirect shares during the period.

In an email to Rappler, ABS-CBN explained that this was because Lopez's stockbroker lodged his PDRs with the Philippine Central Depository. The company said even though the PDRs are no longer under Lopez's name, they still belong to Lopez because they have not been sold. This was reflected in the amended report, since indirect shares refer to stocks held by the person through additional entities.
